metadata.title: CVE-2014-9219 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the redirection feature inurl.php in phpMyAdmin 4.2.x before 4.2.13.1 allows remote attackers toinject arbitrary web script or HTML via the url parameter.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9219` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.2.12-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.2.12-2').
